Add a button. Click and show “hello”

Here's an example of a simple "Hello, World!" HTML code with a button: ``` Hello, World!

Hello, World!

``` This code creates a simple HTML document with a single `` and `` tag. The `` tag defines the text that will be displayed in the document, and the `<button>` tag is used to create a button with an "onclick" event that calls the `showHello()` function when clicked. The `<button>` tag has an `onclick` attribute that specifies the function to call when the button is clicked. In this case, the function is `showHello()`, which will be called when the button is clicked. Here's what the code would look like when the button is clicked: ``` <button onclick="showHello()">Show Hello</button> ``` When the button is clicked, the `showHello()` function is called, which will display "Hello, World!" in the button.
